TrueFactEnglish: Gorillas sleep in nests.

TrueFactSuggestedLineBreak: 大猩猩会回到自己挖的洞穴里睡觉。
FalseFactEnglish: Gorillas sleep in holes they dig in the ground.
FalseFactMandarin: 大猩猩会回到自己挖的洞穴里睡觉。

TrueFactEnglish: Hippo sweat is red (it also doubles as sunscreen).
TrueFactMandarin: 河马的汗水是红色的，还具有防晒功能。
TrueFactSuggestedLineBreak: 河马不会排汗。
FalseFactEnglish: Hippo don't sweat.
FalseFactMandarin: 河马不会排汗。

TrueFactEnglish: Hippos can be more dangerous than lions.
TrueFactMandarin: 河马比狮子更危险。

FalseFactEnglish: Hippos are one of the most harmless animals.
FalseFactMandarin: 河马是世界上最温驯的动物。

TrueFactEnglish: Horses run on their toes.
TrueFactMandarin: 马儿其实是用脚趾奔跑。
TrueFactSuggestedLineBreak: 马儿用脚跟奔跑。
FalseFactEnglish: Horses run on their heels.
FalseFactMandarin: 马儿用脚跟奔跑。

TrueFactEnglish: Hummingbirds are the only birds that can fly backward.
TrueFactMandarin: 蜂鸟是唯一可以倒退飞的鸟类。
TrueFactSuggestedLineBreak: 鹦鹉是唯一可以倒退飞的鸟类。
FalseFactEnglish: Parrots are the only birds that can fly backward.
FalseFactMandarin: 鹦鹉是唯一可以倒退飞的鸟类。

TrueFactEnglish: In the past, toothbrushes had pig hairs for bristles.
TrueFactMandarin: 在古时候，人们利用猪的鬃毛来作为牙刷的刷毛。
TrueFactSuggestedLineBreak: 在古时候，人们利用狗毛来作为牙刷的刷毛。
FalseFactEnglish: In the past, toothbrushes had dog hairs for bristles.
FalseFactMandarin: 在古时候，人们利用狗毛来作为牙刷的刷毛。

TrueFactEnglish: It’s impossible for turtles to stick out their tongues.
TrueFactMandarin: 海龟无法伸出舌头。
TrueFactSuggestedLineBreak: 海龟能把舌头伸长至40厘米。
FalseFactEnglish: Some turtles can stick out their tongues up to 40 centimeters
FalseFactMandarin: 海龟能把舌头伸长至40厘米。

TrueFactEnglish: It’s possible to produce electricity from elephant dung.
TrueFactMandarin: 大象的粪便能产生电能。
TrueFactSuggestedLineBreak: 大象的粪便能作为生产手机的材料。
FalseFactEnglish: It's possible to produce mobile phones from elephant dung.
FalseFactMandarin: 大象的粪便能作为生产手机的材料。

TrueFactEnglish: Japanese Macaques sometimes play with snowballs.
TrueFactMandarin: 日本猕猴会玩雪球。
TrueFactSuggestedLineBreak: 日本猕猴怕雪。
FalseFactEnglish: Japanese Macaques are afraid of the snow.
FalseFactMandarin: 日本猕猴怕雪。

TrueFactEnglish: Kangaroo rats can survive without drinking water.
TrueFactMandarin: 跳囊鼠不必喝水也能生存。
TrueFactSuggestedLineBreak: 跳囊鼠每天需要喝上三加仑的水才能生存。
FalseFactEnglish: Kangaroo rats need to drink 3 gallons of water a day.
FalseFactMandarin: 跳囊鼠每天需要喝上三加仑的水才能生存。

TrueFactEnglish: Kangaroos can jump more than 30 feet in one hop. That’s the length of 12 skateboards.
TrueFactMandarin: 袋鼠一跳可高达9米以上，相等于12个滑板的长度。
TrueFactSuggestedLineBreak: 袋鼠无法跳得比人类高。
FalseFactEnglish: Kangaroos can't jump further than adult humans.
FalseFactMandarin: 袋鼠无法跳得比人类高。

TrueFactEnglish: Kangaroos don’t hop backward.
TrueFactMandarin: 袋鼠不会往后跳。
TrueFactSuggestedLineBreak: 袋鼠可以往后跳。
FalseFactEnglish: Kangaroos often hop backwards.
FalseFactMandarin: 袋鼠可以往后跳。

TrueFactEnglish: King cobras can grow as long as a giraffe is tall.
TrueFactMandarin: 眼镜王蛇的身长可长达长颈鹿的尾巴。

FalseFactEnglish: King cobras stop growing after they reach 5 feet long.
FalseFactMandarin: 眼镜王蛇的身长只能长至1.5米。

TrueFactEnglish: Kinkajous can twist their hind feet backward to climb trees.
TrueFactMandarin: 蜜熊的后脚非常灵活，可任意攀爬树干。

FalseFactEnglish: Kinkajous can turn their heads backwards.
FalseFactMandarin: 蜜熊攀爬树干时，可将头部倒转。

TrueFactEnglish: Koalas and humans have similar fingerprints.
TrueFactMandarin: 树袋熊的指纹与人类相似。
TrueFactSuggestedLineBreak: 树袋熊没有指纹。
FalseFactEnglish: Koalas don’t have fingerprints.
FalseFactMandarin: 树袋熊没有指纹。

TrueFactEnglish: Koalas in southern Australia have thicker fur than koalas in the north.
TrueFactMandarin: 澳大利亚南部树袋熊的毛皮比北方树袋熊的毛皮还要厚。
TrueFactSuggestedLineBreak: 澳大利亚北方树袋熊的毛皮比南方树袋熊的还要厚。
FalseFactEnglish: Koalas in northern Australia have thicker fur than koalas in the south.
FalseFactMandarin: 澳大利亚北方树袋熊的毛皮比南方树袋熊的还要厚。

TrueFactEnglish: Koalas stay awake for only four hours a day.
TrueFactMandarin: 树袋熊每天醒着的时间只有四个小时。
TrueFactSuggestedLineBreak: 树袋熊每天只睡四个小时。
FalseFactEnglish: Koalas only sleep four hours a day.
FalseFactMandarin: 树袋熊每天只睡四个小时。

TrueFactEnglish: Komodo dragons often vomit when threatened.
TrueFactMandarin: 科莫多巨蜥感受到威胁时会呕吐。
TrueFactSuggestedLineBreak: 科莫多巨蜥吃饱时会呕吐。
FalseFactEnglish: Komodo often vomit after a big meal.
FalseFactMandarin: 科莫多巨蜥吃饱时会呕吐。

TrueFactEnglish: Lions spend about 20 hours a day resting.
TrueFactMandarin: 狮子每天休息20个小时左右。

FalseFactEnglish: Lions spend less than 8 hours a day resting.
FalseFactMandarin: 狮子每天休息不超过8个小时。

TrueFactEnglish: Male blue-footed boobies do a high-step strut to attract mates.
TrueFactMandarin: 蓝脚鲣鸟经常做出昂首阔步的动作来吸引伴侣。
TrueFactSuggestedLineBreak: 蓝脚鲣鸟经常做出昂首站立的姿势来吸引伴侣。

FalseFactMandarin: 蓝脚鲣鸟经常做出昂首站立的姿势来吸引伴侣。

TrueFactEnglish: Male giant pandas sometimes do handstands against trees.
TrueFactMandarin: 雄性大熊猫有时会在树上用手倒立。
TrueFactSuggestedLineBreak: 雄性大熊猫有时会爬到树顶上，然后背朝地往下跳。
FalseFactEnglish: Male giant pandas sometimes do backflips off of the tops of trees.
FalseFactMandarin: 雄性大熊猫有时会爬到树顶上，然后背朝地往下跳。

TrueFactEnglish: Many birds’ feathers weigh more than their bones.
TrueFactMandarin: 许多鸟类的羽毛比自身的骨头还要重。

FalseFactEnglish: Most birds’ bones weigh more than their feathers.
FalseFactMandarin: 许多鸟类骨骼比自身的羽毛还要重。

TrueFactEnglish: Monkeys can go bald in old age, just like humans can.
TrueFactMandarin: 猴子跟我们一样，年老时必须面对秃头危机。

FalseFactMandarin: 猴子的头上毛发会不断增长。

TrueFactEnglish: Moonrats spend nights marking their territory with an onionlike smell.
TrueFactMandarin: 刺毛鼩猬会利用整个晚上分泌出一种类似洋葱的气味来划定地盘。

FalseFactMandarin: 刺毛鼩猬会利用整个晚上分泌出一种类似番茄的气味来划定地盘。

TrueFactEnglish: More than two million animals fly in airplanes every year.
TrueFactMandarin: 美国每年有超过200万只动物乘搭飞机。
TrueFactSuggestedLineBreak: 美国每年有超过200万只动物乘搭飞机。
FalseFactEnglish: Less than 250,000 animals fly in airplanes every year.
FalseFactMandarin: 美国每年有超过200万只动物乘搭飞机。

TrueFactEnglish: Most experts believe that birds are descended from dinosaurs.

FalseFactMandarin: 大部分科学家认为，恐龙是鸟类的祖先。

FalseFactMandarin: 大部分的青蛙不敢靠近从自己身上脱落的皮。

TrueFactMandarin: 在英国，大部分天鹅都是属于英国现任女王的。

TrueFactEnglish: Mountain lions can whistle.
TrueFactMandarin: 美洲狮会吹口哨。

TrueFactEnglish: Nosewise, Sturdy, and Hardy were popular dog names in medieval times.
TrueFactMandarin: 在中世纪时代，大多数狗都被取名为努兹维斯（Nosewise）、史都迪（Sturdy）和哈迪（Hardy）。

FalseFactEnglish: Alvin, Simon, and Theodore were popular dog names in medieval times.
FalseFactMandarin: 在中世纪时代，大多数狗都被取名为艾尔文（Alvin）、西门（Simon）和西奥多（Theodore）。

TrueFactEnglish: Oology is the study of bird eggs.

TrueFactEnglish: Penguins swim up to 3,100 miles in a year.

TrueFactEnglish: Pigeons have received medals of honor for military service.

TrueFactEnglish: Porcupine quills were once used as toothpicks.

TrueFactEnglish: Red-footed tortoises have been taught to use touch screens.
TrueFactMandarin: 人类曾经教导红腿象龟使用触控屏幕。

FalseFactMandarin: 小海狮无法在海狮群中认出妈妈的呼叫声。

TrueFactEnglish: Seagulls will perch on pelicans’ heads.

TrueFactEnglish: Skunks have striped skin.
TrueFactMandarin: 臭鼬身边两侧有白色的条纹。

FalseFactMandarin: 臭鼬身边两侧有许多圆形斑点。

TrueFactEnglish: Sloth bears use their snouts and lips like vacuums, sucking up insects for snacks.

FalseFactMandarin: 树袋熊会使用口鼻来吸食昆虫，以作为零食。

FalseFactEnglish: The oldest artic fox den found was 100 years old.

TrueFactEnglish: Some bat’s hearing is strong enough to detect the sound of a beetle walking on a leaf.

TrueFactEnglish: Some bats are light enough to mail with a First-Class Stamp.
TrueFactMandarin: 有些蝙蝠轻得足以使用一等邮票来寄送。

TrueFactEnglish: Some chickens are born half male, half female.

FalseFactMandarin: 所有的鸡一生下来都是母鸡。

TrueFactEnglish: Some chickens lay green or blue eggs.
TrueFactMandarin: 有的母鸡会生下青色或蓝色的鸡蛋。

FalseFactMandarin: 鸡蛋只有白色或褐色。

TrueFactEnglish: Some cobras can spit venom 6.5 feet—that’s longer than a hockey stick.
TrueFactMandarin: 有的眼镜蛇可以吐出2米长的毒液，比曲棍球棒还要长。

FalseFactEnglish: Cobra's venom cannot be spit further than 3 feet.
FalseFactMandarin: 眼镜蛇吐出的毒液只有90厘米长。

TrueFactEnglish: Some cows make best friends with other cattle in their herd.
TrueFactMandarin: 有的牛会与其它牛群里的牛成为好朋友。

TrueFactEnglish: Some dinosaur skulls were about as long as an adult human is tall.

FalseFactMandarin: 恐龙头颅最长只有122厘米。

TrueFactEnglish: Some Dinosaurs had 1,000 teeth.
TrueFactMandarin: 有的恐龙拥有1000颗牙齿。

FalseFactMandarin: 有的大象拥有1000颗牙齿。

TrueFactEnglish: Some dogs are allergic to cats.
TrueFactMandarin: 有的狗会对猫敏感。

FalseFactEnglish: Dogs do not have allergies.
FalseFactMandarin: 狗不会对任何东西敏感。

TrueFactEnglish: Some frogs can glide up to 50 feet through the air.
TrueFactMandarin: 有些青蛙可以在空中滑翔15米。
TrueFactSuggestedLineBreak: 有些青蛙可以飞。
FalseFactEnglish: Some frogs can fly.
FalseFactMandarin: 有些青蛙可以飞。

TrueFactEnglish: Some frogs glow when they eat fireflies.
TrueFactMandarin: 有的青蛙吞下萤火虫后会发亮。

FalseFactEnglish: Some frogs will buzz after eating a fly.
FalseFactMandarin: 有的青蛙吞下苍蝇后会嗡嗡叫。

TrueFactEnglish: Some frogs survive the winter by freezing almost solid.
TrueFactMandarin: 有的青蛙会把自己冷冻起来过冬。
TrueFactSuggestedLineBreak: 有的青蛙会结茧过冬。

TrueFactEnglish: Some hummingbirds weigh less than a penny.
TrueFactMandarin: 有些蜂鸟的体重比1美分硬币还要轻。

FalseFactEnglish: Hummingbirds weigh less than 4 grains of rice.
FalseFactMandarin: 有些蜂鸟的体重比四颗米饭还要轻。

TrueFactMandarin: 有些公鼠求偶时会唱歌。

TrueFactMandarin: 泰国有些猴子会教猴宝宝使用牙线。

TrueFactMandarin: 有的猪会害怕接触泥巴。
TrueFactSuggestedLineBreak: 所有的猪都喜欢滚泥巴。
FalseFactEnglish: All pigs love the mud.
FalseFactMandarin: 所有的猪都喜欢滚泥巴。

TrueFactEnglish: Some pigs have curly hair.
TrueFactMandarin: 有的猪拥有一身卷毛。
TrueFactSuggestedLineBreak: 所有的猪都拥有一身竖直的毛发。
FalseFactEnglish: Pigs hair is always perfectly straight.
FalseFactMandarin: 所有的猪都拥有一身竖直的毛发。

TrueFactEnglish: Some rats appear to laugh when tickled.
TrueFactMandarin: 有的老鼠被瘙痒时会发出笑声。

FalseFactMandarin: 有的老鼠会听笑话，而且会跟着笑出来。

FalseFactMandarin: 老鼠每天需要喝下一加仑的水。

TrueFactMandarin: 有些火蜥蜴能重新长出尾巴、腿，甚至是眼睛。

TrueFactMandarin: 有的蜗牛可使用身体分泌出的泡沫粘液漂浮在水面上。

FalseFactEnglish: Snails can't travel through water.

FalseFactMandarin: 有些蜗牛有五万颗牙齿。

TrueFactMandarin: 有些毒青蛙能自行分泌糖分，使毒液产生甜味。

FalseFactMandarin: 南非洲狮经常攻击大牛蛙。

FalseFactMandarin: 松鼠通过舌头排汗。

TrueFactMandarin: 燕窝的主要成分是金丝雀的唾液。

TrueFactMandarin: 三角龙是怀俄明的国家恐龙。

FalseFactMandarin: 翼龙是美国怀俄明州的州代表恐龙。

TrueFactEnglish: The world’s oldest pet goldfish lived to be 43 years old.

TrueFactEnglish: There are more plastic flamingos than real ones.

TrueFactEnglish: To keep from drifting apart, sleeping otters may link paws.
TrueFactMandarin: 为了不被急流冲走，水獭会靠在岸边，并且双手合十。
TrueFactSuggestedLineBreak: 为了不被急流冲走，水獭会靠在岸边，把尾巴绑在同伴的尾巴上。

FalseFactMandarin: 为了不被急流冲走，水獭会靠在岸边，把尾巴绑在同伴的尾巴上。

TrueFactMandarin: 跗猴一双眼睛可重达它们脑袋的重量。

FalseFactEnglish: Together, a tarsier’s huge eyes can weigh less than it's brain.

TrueFactEnglish: Turtles lived on Earth before dinosaurs did.
TrueFactMandarin: 海龟比恐龙更早出现在地球上。

FalseFactEnglish: Earliest evidence of turtles living on earth is in 1495.
FalseFactMandarin: 最新研究结果显示，海龟在1495年出现于地球上。

TrueFactEnglish: Tyrannosaurus rex means “tyrant lizard king” in Latin.
TrueFactMandarin: 在拉丁文里，暴龙的意思是“蜥蜴之王”。

FalseFactEnglish: Tyrannosaurus rex means “Tired Rain Prince” in Latin.
FalseFactMandarin: 在拉丁文里，暴龙的意思是“雨中之王”。

TrueFactEnglish: Warm frogs croak faster than cold frogs.

FalseFactEnglish: Warm frogs croak slower than cold frogs.
FalseFactMandarin: 在温度较高的环境下，青蛙呱呱叫的频率较少。

FalseFactMandarin: 僧帽猴通过拍拍头顶和揉揉肚腩的动作向同伴问好。

FalseFactEnglish: Young koalas sometimes smell like french fries.
FalseFactMandarin: 树袋熊宝宝会散发出类似炸薯条的体味。
